column1: atha sā devatā tad adhiṣṭhānam avāsṛjat /
column2: Then, the goddess released her magical power and each returned to their ordinary form.

column1: atha sā devatāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputram evam āha kva nu te bhadantaśāriputra strīrūpaṃ kṛtaṃ gatam /
column2: She then said to him, “Reverend Śāriputra, what have you done with your female form?” Śāriputra

column1: āha na tat kṛtaṃ na vikṛtam /
column2: I neither made it nor did I change it.

column1: āha evam eva sarvadharmā na kṛtā na vikṛtāḥ / yatra ca na kṛtir na vikṛtis tad buddhavacanam /
column2: Just so, all things are neither made nor changed, and that they are not made and not changed, that is the teaching of the Buddha.

column1: āha itas tvaṃ devate cyutā kutropapatsyase /
column2: Goddess, where will you be born when you transmigrate after death?

column1: āha yatraiva tathāgatanirmita upapatsyate, tatraivāham upapatsye /
column2: I will be born where all the magical incarnations of the Tathāgata are born.

column1: āha tathāgatanirmitasya na cyutir nopapattiḥ /
column2: But the emanated incarnations of the Tathāgata do not transmigrate nor are they born.

column1: āha evam eva sarvadharmāṇāṃ na cyutir nopapattiḥ /
column2: All things and living beings are just the same they do not transmigrate nor are they born!

column1: āha kiyaccireṇa punar devate bodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase /
column2: Goddess, how soon will you attain the perfect enlightenment of buddhahood?

column1: āha yadā sthaviraḥ pṛthagjanadharmasamanvāgato bhaviṣyati, tadāhaṃ bodhim abhisaṃbhotsye /
column2: At such time as you, elder, become endowed once more with the qualities of an ordinary individual, then will I attain the perfect enlightenment of buddhahood.

column1: āha asthānam etad devate yad ahaṃ pṛthagjanadharmasamanvāgataḥ syām /
column2: Goddess, it is impossible that I should become endowed once more with the qualities of an ordinary individual.

column1: āha evam eva bhadantaśāriputra asthānam etad yad ahaṃ bodhim abhisaṃbhotsye /
column2: Just so, reverend Śāriputra, it is impossible that I should attain the perfect enlightenment of buddhahood!

column1: asthānasthitaiva hi bodhiḥ /
column2: Because perfect enlightenment stands upon the impossible.

column1: tasmād asthānaṃ na kaścid abhisaṃbhotsyate /
column2: Because it is impossible, no one attains the perfect enlightenment of buddhahood.

column1: sthavira āha
column2: Śāriputra

column1: uktaṃ devate tathāgatena ḥgaṅgānadīvālikāsamās tathāgatā abhisaṃbuddhā abhisaṃbudhyante 'bhisaṃbhotsyante caḥ /
column2: But the Tathāgata has declared “The tathāgatas, who are as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, have attained perfect buddhahood, are attaining perfect buddhahood, and will go on attaining perfect buddhahood.”

column1: devatāha akṣaragaṇanāsaṃketādhivacanam etad bhadantaśāriputra atītānāgatapratyutpannā buddhā iti /
column2: Goddess Reverend Śāriputra, the expression “the buddhas of the past, present, and future” is a conventional expression made up of a certain number of syllables.

column1: na punar buddhā atītā vānāgatā vā vartamānā vā /
column2: The buddhas are neither past, nor present, nor future.

column1: tryadhvasamatikrāntā hi bodhiḥ /
column2: Their enlightenment transcends the three times!

column1: api ca prāptaṃ sthavireṇārhatvam /
column2: But tell me, elder, have you attained the state of arhat?

column1: āha prāptam asaṃprāptikāraṇena /
column2: It is attained, because there is no attainment.

column1: āha evam evābhisaṃbodhir anabhisaṃbodhikāraṇena /
column2: Just so, there is perfect enlightenment because there is no attainment of perfect enlightenment.

column1: atha vimalakīrtir licchavir āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputram evam āha dvānavatibuddhakoṭīparyupāsitā bhadantaśāriputra eṣā devatābhijñājñānavikrīḍitā praṇidhānasamucchritā
column2: Then the Licchavi Vimalakīrti said to the venerable elder Śāriputra, “Reverend Śāriputra, this goddess has already served ninetytwo million billion buddhas. She plays with the superknowledges. She has truly succeeded in all her vows.

column1: kṣāntipratilabdhāvaivartikasamavasaraṇā praṇidhānavaśena yathecchati tathā tiṣṭhati satvaparipākāya // //
column2: She has gained the tolerance of the birthlessness of things. She has actually attained irreversibility. She can live wherever she wishes on the strength of her vow to develop living beings.”

column1: atha khalu mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūto vimalakīrtiṃ licchavim evam āha kathaṃ kulaputra bodhisatvo gatiṃgato bhavati buddhadharmeṣu /
column2: Then, the crown prince Mañjuśrī asked the Licchavi Vimalakīrti, “‌Noble sir, how does the bodhisattva follow the way to attain the qualities of the Buddha?”

column1: āha yadā mañjuśrīḥ bodhisatvo 'gatigamanaṃ gacchati, tadā bodhisatvo gatiṃgato bhavati buddhadharmeṣu /
column2: Vimalakīrti replied, “Mañjuśrī, when the bodhisattva follows the wrong way, he follows the way to attain the qualities of the Buddha.”

column1: āha katamac ca bodhisatvasyāgatigamanam /
column2: Mañjuśrī continued, “How does the bodhisattva follow the wrong way?”

column1: āha yadā pañcānantaryagatiṃ ca gacchati, na ca vyāpādavihiṃsāpraduṣṭo bhavati /
column2: Vimalakīrti replied, “Even should he enact the five deadly sins, he feels no malice, violence, or hate.

column1: nirayagatiṃ ca gacchati, sarvarajaḥkleśavigataś ca bhavati /
column2: Even should he go into the hells, he remains free of all taint of afflictions.
